Text.Text: Hrnnh... suppose ye tell me whether I shoot ye or welcome ye - ye've not the *look* of the snakes about ye, but... nnnh...  I don't see as well as I might.

Hrnnh... they've sent a filthy duergar to finish me off, is it?  But... ye've not the *look* of the snakes about ye, but... nnnh... ye've got black blood in yer soul, and that's damning enough, it is.
Hrnnh... they've sent a filthy drow to finish me off, is it?  But... ye've not the *look* of the snakes about ye, but... nnnh... ye've got black blood in yer soul, and that's damning enough, it is.
Hrnnh... they've sent an orog whelp to finish me off, is it?  But... ye've not the *look* of the snakes about ye, but... nnnh... ye've got orc blood, and that's damning enough, it is.
Hrnnh... either those snake arrows have struck deeper than I thought, or yer a deep gnome.  By the Gods... enh... what the hells is one of yer kind doing here?
By the Gods... hrnhh... thought I'd bleed to death here before anyone found me - hrmm.  I... nhh... suppose the fact yer an *elf* is something I'll have to stomach.
By the Gods... hrnhh... thought I'd bleed to death 'fore anyone found me - Clangeddin be doubly blessed, ye're one of me kin!  Tell me... have ye brought anymore of yer clan?
By the Gods... hrnhh... thought I'd bleed to death 'fore anyone found me - Clangeddin has a sense of humor to send a stunty gnome.  At least... nhh... you're not that lackwit Fiddlebender.

Those damned snake-men is who.  After I... nhhh... split a few of their skulls from tooth to tail, they backed off... and filled me with arrows.  Slithering cowards!  Should... should've wiped them out *years* ago.
Gerbash be me name... nnh... and a proud one... though I never thought I'd die an *innkeeper*... pah.  Who sent ye?  Jermsy?  Nathaniel?
Never ye mind - look, ye need to get to safety - take this key, it's... nnh... not safe here with me.  It's the key to the tower in the Pass west of here... take it to them, if ye can.
Aye, Gerbash be me name... nnh... and a proud one... though I never thought I'd die an *innkeeper*... pah.  Who sent ye?  Jermsy?  Nathaniel?

Aye, for a human, Jermsy can be a right *ass,* but... nnhh... he's right.  I still have the key... an' now I'm giving it to ye.  Promise me ye'll get it back to him - it belongs back at the tower, not with some half-dead dwarf.
Serves 'im right, Jermsy was a right *ass,* but... nnhh... if he's dead, then there's no use in giving ye the key - there's no one left to hold the tower.
Hrnn... no matter.  Thought I could get out of town... get reinforcements... but it seems Fiddlebender made good on his promise - heh.  I'll be all right... just want to rest a bit...

Hmmph... *thank* ye - not as good as dwarven stout, but still...  ahhh... I'm feelin' me old strength return, I am, so ye better not be wastin' time coddlin' me.  Deliver that damned key - I don't need ye here playing priest when the yuan-ti are about!

Hmmph... *thank* ye - not as good as dwarven stout, but still...  ahhh... I'm feelin' me old strength return, I am, so ye better not be wastin' time coddlin' me.  I don't need ye here playing priest when the yuan-ti might be lurkin' about!
Did ye... deliver that damned key yet?  I... hnn... don't need ye here playing priest when the yuan-ti are about!
Leave me be; I just need some time to catch me wind, is all.  There's others be needin' more help than me, I'm sure.
Ennnh... leave me be; I just need some time to catch me wind, is all.  There's... enhh... others be needin' more help than me, I'm sure.
Hmmph... *thank* ye.  I'm feelin' better, I am, so ye better not be wastin' time coddlin' me.  Did ye deliver that damned key yet?  I don't need ye here playing priest when the yuan-ti are about!
Hmmph.  I'm feelin' better, I am, so ye better not be here to be coddlin' me.  Did ye deliver that damned key yet?  I don't need ye here playing priest when the yuan-ti are about!
Aye... hmmph.  I wanted to thank ye for yer help earlier.  Not that I needed it, mind ye, but still - ye arrived just in time, ye did.
Aye, ye're right - look, take this - I figure a little gold and gems might be a right way as any to show me thanks.  Take it with me blessing.
Thank again ye for yer help earlier.  Again, not that I *needed* it, mind ye, but still - it may be ye arrived just in time, ye did.

Well... hrnn... it's just that I wasn't expecting to get a helping hand from - well, from one of *yer* kind, is all.  I suppose it's not the face, it's the heart, aye?  Something for me to chew on, I think.
Bah, get ye away from me.  All yer kind is the same - ye can take yer "help" and stick it in yer skull, ye can.
Who are you - and who did this to you?
Are you Gerbash?
Who are you - and who did this to you?
Are you Gerbash?
I'd watch your words, especially considering we've come from the Ten-Towns to stop Kuldahar from being turned into kindling.  Who attacked you?
Well, one of us is in better shape than the other - and I suggest you not forget that, dwarf.  Are you Gerbash?
Who are you - and who did this to you?
Are you Gerbash?
I'd watch your words, especially considering we've come from the Ten-Towns to stop Kuldahar from being turned into kindling.  Who attacked you?
Well, one of us is in better shape than the other - and I suggest you not forget that, dwarf.  Are you Gerbash?
Who are you - and who did this to you?
Are you Gerbash?
I'd watch your words, especially considering we've come from the Ten-Towns to stop Kuldahar from being turned into kindling.  Who attacked you?
Well, one of us is in better shape than the other - and I suggest you not forget that, dwarf.  Are you Gerbash?
I am.  But who are you - and who did this to you?
The story of how I came to be here would be a long one - are you Gerbash?
Who are you - and who did this to you?
Are you Gerbash?
I'd watch your words, especially considering we've come from the Ten-Towns to stop your town from being turned into cordwood.  Who attacked you?
Well, one of us is in better shape than the other - and I suggest you not forget that, dwarf.  Are you Gerbash?
No, but I have come to help.  Who are you - and who did this to you?
No, but I have come to help.  Are you Gerbash?
Who are you - and who did this to you?
Are you Gerbash?
I'd watch your words, especially considering we've come from the Ten-Towns to stop Kuldahar from being turned into kindling.  Who attacked you?
Well, one of us is in better shape than the other - and I suggest you not forget that, dwarf.  Are you Gerbash?
Neither of them... who are you talking about?
Very well.  We will take the key to them.  But what of you?
Jermsy wanted us to find you - he was worried you'd died, and he was worried the watchtower key you had had fallen into the yuan-ti's hands.
Jermsy had... an *accident.*  But he wanted me to get that key from you.
Very well.  We will take the key to them.  But what of you?
Never mind the key, then.  What of you?
I may be able to heal your wounds, Gerbash - hang on.
Let me lay on hands and restore your strength, Gerbash - hang on.
I may be able to draw upon nature to mend your wounds, Gerbash - hang on.
One of my songs may be able to heal you, Gerbash - hang on.
Here, drink this elixir of health.
This healing potion may help - drink it down.
Perhaps a potion of extra-healing can help your wounds.
This Spirit Essence should mend your wounds.
Here, drink this elixir of health.
This healing potion may help - drink it down.
Perhaps a potion of extra-healing can help your wounds.
This Spirit Essence should mend your wounds.
We will see the key to the tower gets to its owner.  Farewell, Gerbash.
Sleep then, Gerbash.
Rest then, dwarf.  There is little to be done for you now.
Not yet.  We will see the key to the tower gets to its owner.  Farewell, Gerbash.
We have, Gerbash.  We were just checking on you.
Very well.  Farewell, Gerbash.
We have - but I may be able to heal your wounds, Gerbash - hang on.
We have - but let me lay on hands and restore your strength, Gerbash - hang on.
We have - but I may be able to draw upon nature to mend your wounds, Gerbash - hang on.

We're all in this together, Gerbash.  We have to stick together, or the Legion will overrun us.
We're all in this together, Gerbash.  We have to stick together, or the Legion will overrun us.

Maybe next time you won't be so quick to dismiss an offer of help.
Maybe next time you won't be so quick to dismiss an offer of help.
Maybe next time you won't be so quick to dismiss an offer of help.
Maybe next time you won't be so quick to dismiss an offer of help.
Maybe next time you won't be so quick to dismiss an offer of help.
Maybe next time you won't be so quick to dismiss an offer of help.
Keep your wealth, Gerbash - I wished to help you, and I do not need gold as proof of your thanks.
The tenets of my order prevent me from taking your wealth, Gerbash - and I do not need gold as proof of your thanks.  The gesture is appreciated, but not necessary.
Thanks, Gerbash.  This should help.
We're all in this together, Gerbash.  We have to stick together, or the Legion will overrun us.
Next time we may not... and maybe next time you won't be so quick to dismiss an offer of help.  Farewell.
Well, I wouldn't go around trusting every drow you meet from now on, Gerbash - but your words are appreciated.
Well, I wouldn't go around trusting every drow you meet from now on, Gerbash - but your words are appreciated.
Well, I wouldn't go around trusting every drow you meet from now on, Gerbash - but your words are appreciated.
Well, I wouldn't go around trusting every half-orc you meet from now on, Gerbash - but your words are appreciated.
Well, I wouldn't go around trusting every half-orc you meet from now on, Gerbash - but your words are appreciated.
Well, I wouldn't go around trusting every half-orc you meet from now on, Gerbash - but your words are appreciated.
Well, I wouldn't go around trusting every duergar you meet from now on, Gerbash - but your words are appreciated.
Well, I wouldn't go around trusting every duergar you meet from now on, Gerbash - but your words are appreciated.
Well, I wouldn't go around trusting every duergar you meet from now on, Gerbash - but your words are appreciated.
Thanks, Gerbash.  Fighting the Legion is hard enough without fighting each other.
Thanks, Gerbash.  Fighting the Legion is hard enough without fighting each other.
Thanks, Gerbash.  Fighting the Legion is hard enough without fighting each other.
Thanks, Gerbash.  Fighting the Legion is hard enough without fighting each other.

Thanks, Gerbash.  Fighting the Legion is hard enough without fighting each other.
Thanks, Gerbash.  Fighting the Legion is hard enough without fighting each other.
Well, I didn't think much of dwarves, either, until I met you, and I *still* don't, so chew on that, dog.  Farewell... and good riddance.
Well, I didn't think much of you surface dwarves, either, until I met you, and I *still* don't, so chew on that, dog.  Farewell.  Farewell... and good riddance.
